Package gui.controller

Class SceneController

java.lang.Object
gui.controller.SceneController
public class SceneController
extends java.lang.Object
This class implements the methods, that are responsible for the change of the scene.
Author:
Judith

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event> endGame
    This method ends the game.
    (package private) Game game
    the game that is initialized in the methods
    javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event> setSceneToDifficultyScene
    This method sets the scene to the scene in which the player chooses the level of difficulty when starting a new game.
    javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event> setSceneToEasyGameScene
    This method starts a new game with level of difficulty easy.
    javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event> setSceneToHardGameScene
    This method starts a new game with level of difficulty hard.
    javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event> setSceneToHelpScene
    This method sets the scene to the helpScene.
    javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event> setSceneToMediumGameScene
    This method starts a new game with level of difficulty medium.
    javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event> setSceneToMenuScene
    This method sets the scene back to the menu scene.
    javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event> setSceneToReloadGameScene
    This method reloads the saved game.

    • setSceneToMenuScene

      public javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.Event> setSceneToMenuScene
      This method sets the scene back to the menu scene. It is needed in the difficultyScene and the helpScene for the buttons back.
